text: (bright upbeat music)
- My name is Paresh Mundade,

and I'm a software developer
manager with AWS, Route 53.
As a kid, I wanted to do a lot of things.
Wanted to start off as an architect first,

then I realized my
drawing wasn't that great.

Eventually, I wanted to
be a network engineer
and that's what I became.
I really liked the scale
at which this company is operating at AWS.
I've been a cloud person in general,
I believe in the cloud technologies.
And the scale and the people,

the sharpness of the people
is what bought me here.
Plus, the company gives the opportunities

for the career growth and
development quite a bit,
which I love.
Since I've been at Amazon,
I feel that I've grown quite a bit,
not just in terms of my personality,
like, in how I conduct myself,

but also technically
I've grown quite a bit.

I've had opportunity to
work with a scale of,

set of different set of
people, different teams.
I've been able to ask for opportunities

that I want to grow in and
I've been provided them.
That opportunity is very rare to find.

So if a friend of mine
were to apply for AWS,
I would be extremely supportive.
In fact, I've been already doing that,
telling my friends to go apply for them.

Sometimes that they might be
worried about certain things.

And I try to usually
tell them that, you know,
"That you'll definitely enjoy the company,

the people and the
technologies and the scale,
the kind of work to be done.
You'll get basically it's a one-stop shop

for everything that
your career needs are."

You know, "Don't make any
judgements before applying.
Just go for it, give it a shot.
Life is all about experimenting.
If you don't try, you'll never know."
(bright upbeat music)
